title: ISic003462. I.Sicily inscription 003462
body:
1[Pro beatitudine temporum d(ominorum) n(ostrorum)]
2[Constanti et Constantis Aug(ustorum)]
3[station(em) fec(it)? Vitr]asius Orfitus v(ir) c(larrisimus) cons(ularis) p(rovinciae) S(iciliae)
4instante Fl(avio) Valeriano duc(enario) ag(ente) in r(e)b(us) p(rae)p(osito) cursus
5publici

1[...........................]
2[............................]
3[................]ASIUSORFITUSVCCONSPS
4INSTANTEFLVALERIANODUCAGINRBPPCURSUS
5PUBLICI

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Silvestrini 2014, supplements based upon ISic000481

translation

commentary

Two fragments, excavated 8 years apart; the first fragment lost shortly after discovery, and a single photo survives; second fragment preserved. Text is a close parallel to CIL 10.7200 from Thermae Selinuntiae, but records activities in building / restoring the cursus publicus by Memmius Vitrasius Orfitus alone, without Flavius Dulcitius who is also named in the other inscription. Silvestrini offers a full reconstruction of the text (upper part missing) on the basis of CIL 10.7200 = ISic000481

bibliography

  • Silvestrini 2014 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001580
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence
